page.title: 03Norton-on-Derwent(continued)
page.content:
An excellent 18 hole golf course is situated to the south-west of the town in some delightful countryside and the river Derwent provides good opportunities for angling. The local Ramblers' Association arrange interesting walks to suit all ages and abilties.
Norton-on-Derwent is semi-rural. It has seen, during the past twelve years, a rapid expansion of residential development. However, it has managed to retain an air of tranquility with reasonable amenities; a situation which many who are subject to the more extreme environment may envy.
